meanings.sent1: The propagative seeds quickly grew into tall trees.
meanings.sent2: Her propagative behavior led to the success of the project.
meanings.sent3: The propagative flowers seemed to dance in the wind.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were as propagative as a wildfire, spreading rapidly.
meanings.sent5: The propagative nature of the virus made it difficult to contain.

meanings.definition: Capable of spreading or promoting ideas or beliefs
meanings.sent1: The propagative speech inspired many to take action.
meanings.sent2: Social media can be a propagative tool for sharing information.
meanings.sent3: The propagative rumors about the ghost in the attic amused the children.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as propagative as sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The propagative power of storytelling can change hearts and minds.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to produce offspring or new plants
meanings.sent1: The propagative rabbits multiplied quickly in the field.
meanings.sent2: Healthy soil is essential for propagative plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The propagative vines in the garden provided a lush green backdrop.
meanings.sent4: The family tree was as propagative as a forest, with many branches.
meanings.sent5: The propagative nature of the apple tree ensured a bountiful harvest.
